website_summaries.verdict: A nice lightweight cot that is comfortable for short people.
pros: Simple set up and very comfortable
cons: At 69 inches in length, this cot is a little shorter and smaller than a previous version of the same model

website_summaries.verdict: This basic cot is a comfortable, durable pick for camp-outs and sleepovers, as long as you're on the shorter side.
pros: Steel frame can support up to 275 pounds
Most comfortable for people up to 5-foot 7-inches tall
Measures 69-inches long by 25-inches wide by 15-inches high unfolded
cons: If you're taller than 5-foot 7, you can use this cot, but your feet may hang off the end

customer_reviews.title: nice closure, sturdy and stable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered Coleman Cot when it was on the deal of the day, for my studio apartment. I made a mattress from blue foam, but THIS COMES WITH a thin (inch or two) plaid topper. Mine is as comfortable as a bed, but smaller (it even has a bed skirt) but I took it off for the photo. I like its easy to carry closure, I seldom move mine but if I were using it for camping or company that would be a definite asset, it is light weight too. I however, am not "lightweight" I weighed 250 when I first started sleeping on this cot, now 230 and it was and is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Ahrens

customer_reviews.title: If you're oversized, this is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, so I'm a big guy. In all directions. I'm kinda tall and I'm wide and I'm totin' some tonnage, so you wonder whether this thing is up to the task. It is. For us biggins, the extra width of this is welcome, the length is nice, and it's pretty comfortable. It's also easy to setup and foldup. I used it for about 15 nights last summer and so far so good. We'll see how well the springs hold up over time, but I'm optimistic so far. If you're oversized, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Carter

customer_reviews.title: Cigarette smoke.
customer_reviews.text: Recieved our cot in good condition except for it smelling like cigarette smoke. It was so saturated in cigarette smoke smell that it made our whole office, car, and room stink like cigarettes (whichever space it was in). Makes me think that we received an old, used one that had been used for cigarette breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Ohashi

customer_reviews.title: Daily Use For Several Weeks
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Using in tandem with a lightweight sleeping bag for indoor use. Purchased this cot in lieu of buying furniture for a temporary living situation. I've been sleeping on this cot for 10-12 days at a time while working remotely and find it to be very comfortable. My roommate purchased one, too. Both cots have been used for over a month with no problems. I'm 200 pounds, 6'1", and my roommate is 250 lbs and about 6'. The lightweight cot is easy to fold up and transport, sets up in under a minute, and is very comfortable for extended use. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Slattery

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the reviews. Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: I cant believe the amazing reviews this cot is crap. It literally has no support only springs mounted around the perimeter just to hold it in place. It slides, moves and bounces all over the place. Feels unsafe and changing sleeping positions requires courage and prayer because it feels like the thing is going to flip. One reviewer wrote "more comfortable than my bed" I guess his bed is made of broken glass, rusty nails and stale cool ranch doritos. Save your money this is a "NOT, nope not a "COT"
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Paid for a new cot... received a dirty, smelly, used cot...twice.
customer_reviews.text: I will attempt to buy this at a local department store. Mine arrived smelly and used. I'm hoping that a local department store sells it as an actually new item if it is listed new. I bought this as a new product and after receiving the first one, sent it back because it was clearly gross, and used. After, receiving the exact same one again, I will just pay for a product that I can inspect before I purchase it. Most stores do not sell used cots or inflatable mattresses anymore for this reason and it violates health codes (perhaps that varies state to state but most are afraid of bed-bugs related penalties). Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Krisy M

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this cot after my friend highly recommended it to me. Theirs came delivered (in a box) perfectly fine. My cot came late, wrapped in a single layer of extremely thin plastic, not even covering the entire cot, just in the very center, I’m assuming to keep it from unfolding and to have something to put the shipping label on, and scratched up all over from shipping. Could return it and get another but just not worth it. Extremely disappointed since I’ve only heard good things about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful comfy cot with pad
customer_reviews.text: Got 2 of these for my husband and I for tent camping. Love the mattress, very comfortable. I don't need anything more than what's provided. We both have back issues and cervical issues, so this is a really terrific find. And they are very easy to fold and store. One has to remember that to store the mat on the underside (under the metal fold-up legs) to fit properly and conveniently. I had no problem with the velcro strap fitting so long as it's collapsed this way (mat underneath, not on top of cot).
customer_reviews.author: R Vancleve

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Damaged
customer_reviews.text: The center leg was taller than the legs at the head and foot. We were unable to fully straighten out the cot. The edges of the metal hinges were also damaged, bent, and very sharp. There were also 4 springs that were not attached to the frame. The cot arrived in only a thin white plastic wrap which had several rips and tears. We returned the cot for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it...
customer_reviews.text: Don't get this one, trust me, just don't. Was so excited to use it and turned out to be a HUGE disappointment. Pad (mattress), which is fine, slides off. Constantly. Camped for three nights with it and didn't sleep for three nights! Return window closed two days before my camp date. I'm sad about this cot not working..... Colman got its money and I'll have precious garage space taken up.
customer_reviews.author: j_90

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, this bed is a huge upgrade from an air mattress. There is no need to improve on the mattress what so ever. As of this post, I haven't had any prolonged use, but right after unboxing I laid on it, and never wanted to get up. The size of this thing is quite a bit bigger than I might have wanted, but you can't complain when you have comfort while camping.
customer_reviews.author: Cade C. HinesTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great for Tent Camping
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husbands camping trips. Happy to say he is one happy camper. The cot is small enough to fit in our mini suv, and yet large enough to hold his 210lb body. He notes that it is really comfortable with just a sleeping pad, no springs coming through to pinch him and he gets a better night sleep than laying on the hard ground. Overall for a birthday gift, I say win-win.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Great cot.
customer_reviews.text: Great cot. Purchased it for our granddaughters for when they visit since we do not have enough beds. Our oldest slept all night with no problems. Of course that might be because she is a teenager and they can sleep anywhere. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The springs are starting to wear out and the support sagging already.
customer_reviews.author: LadyT

customer_reviews.title: Structural failure
customer_reviews.text: Initially 5 stars, but after six months of occasional use (less than 20), one of the wires within the fabric that the springs attached to ripped out. The stated weight limit is 300lbs and I'm 165 so I see no reason for a structural failure like that
customer_reviews.author: HoWc

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, comfortable and super handy at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: It is not the lightest piece of gear but it is not overly heavy for what it is. I suppose it could be lighter but at this price point you simply cant beat it! It is very strong, very well made, and super comfortable. I was pleasantly surprised to see it actually came with a cushion top to put on top of it. Nice and thick and cushy. I was planning on buying my own so I was pleased to see it came with one. It folds up well in stores easy. I am pleased with this purchase and I would recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Justaguy

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and proved to be comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and proved to be comfortable. We bought this for our granddaughter to sleep on over Christmas stay. Was successful for that. I doubt that I, a full size senior citizen, would want to try sleeping on it! It is good quality. I read some criticisms that the mattress slipped off. Valid - however easily fixed. My wife sewed tapes on all four corners of the mattress and we tied it to the frame. No slipping problem! Maybe the manufacturer could do that.
customer_reviews.author: RossDC

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a larger man who is a side sleeper
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a larger man who is a side sleeper. Although there is a center bar, it rests about 2" below the center of the cot. Really great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Best cot for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is good and long at 80-inches and nice at 30-inches wide. Easy to set up and folds up nice to stow away. My old extra long Therm-a-Rest mattress fits perfectly with the included mattress, and the two together feels like sleeping on a cloud. The last time I slept on a cot camping I thought the thing was going to fold up on me when I turn over while sleeping. My wife had some cheap junk cots we used camping, and my main concern was the pressure points the legs had on the tent floor. I was looking for a cot with legs just like this one to distribute the pressure on the tent floor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for people with low back problems!
customer_reviews.text: The cot is not comfortable like what others are stating. Anymore than 6 hours on this cot and my lower back pain is excruciating. I've used it for about a month now the mattress has sunk in the middle. The seams on the mattress has also started breaking apart. To also confirm what others are saying, when folded, it takes up a huge amount of space so take that into consideration. The cot itself is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Best camping sleep I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I'll never buy another air mattress again. This thing is great. I wish I would have done this years ago. I can see that the little mattress is cheap and will get flattened out after several uses but when that happens, I'll put a thermarest under it for extra cushion. I've slept on it for a total of 10 nights now and I have no complaints. No, it's not bed-level comfort/quality, but for camping it's great and air mattresses are not even in the same ballpark. If you're still camping in a tent and tired of air mattresses, do yourself a favor and buy a cot.
customer_reviews.author: Jon G.

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love this! So comfortable! I got tired of air mattresses and love this for a change. It is bulkier than an air mattress when folded up, but that is only drawback. It fits nicely in my car trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: The cot itself is not so comfortable to sleep on
customer_reviews.text: The cot itself is not so comfortable to sleep on. However, it is plenty strong enough to support a more comfortable mattress. We tied two cots together and laid a full-sized "bed in a box" type of mattress across the cots to create a bed in the back of our van for a 6-night van camping trip. The cots performed well in this way and also provided space beneath the bed to store camping supplies.
customer_reviews.author: Building a House

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for something cheap, this is the product for you
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought two back in April. Since then we have only used them a couple times. Its fairly comfortable, easy, and quick to set up. I'm only giving it 2 stars because when you sleep on it the mattress slides everywhere and causes slight discomfort. Also one of the mattress has a 2in tear right in the middle and the other is starting to tear in the exact same spot. We have taken very good care of these and stored them properly, we are pretty disappointed but none the less are looking into buying a patch to put over it.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie Smith

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the grandkids and they seem to enjoy sleeping on it. They take turns and it always seems that whoever sleeps on the cot sleeps in longer! Easy to put up. The take down is a bit more complicated (It took me a little while to figure out that the mattress has to slide in on the underside). Sometimes the velcro strap doesn't hold. But, for the money, it was a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Lagorio

customer_reviews.title: Great little cot, human and dog approved
customer_reviews.text: Bought his for a upcoming trip so I havent' used it a lot yet. But from the short tests I did It is great. Easy to fold, and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Knoxie

customer_reviews.title: A Very Comfortable Sleep
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this as a regular bed, in lieu of a futon. I figured it had good reviews and was returnable. I've used it for a week now and I'm very happy with it. The first thing I noticed was the length of it made it very comfortable, my feet don't hang off the bottom. The first night I wasn't so sure if I'd like it, it was comfortable, but different from a regular mattress or futon. But the second, and each since, night I slept well. It's big enough to be comfortable but small enough to fit a small bedroom easily. It's a comfortable cot to sleep on and I'd highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy K. Archie

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable than I thought.
customer_reviews.text: My sister bought this cot for me when I was at her house. I could not believe how good I slept. I am not a heavy person nevertheless the cot has springs which allows some give when lying on the mattress. I liked it so much I bought one for my house and slept on it for a week when I had company. The cot is easy to fold and I have mine stored in my closet. I have the regular size, not the long cot.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable cot
customer_reviews.text: I'm an older person with some extra weight, and I was pleasantly surprised by the comfort of the cot. No bars poking into my back or side. The mattress, though thin, added to the comfortable sleep while camping. As comfortable as a bed for me. The only negative I found so far is that the mattress tends to slip off the side of the cot a bit. I may sew some "Velcro" (hook and loop) straps to the sides of the mattress and loop them around the frame. Otherwise very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Mary-Ann M

customer_reviews.title: Cot Over Air Mattress
customer_reviews.text: First shipment came damaged, but received a return label and replacement product within 48 hours. Do not waste money on an air mattress you'll have to maintain (air loss). This is a little bulky, so if you have a car I wouldn't recommend it, but otherwise it's perfect for camping. Less than a five minute set up and tear down, and provides great sleep. Will always use this over our air mattress unless I have limited packing space. Can't believe I waited so long to try out a cot.
customer_reviews.author: Mana

customer_reviews.title: After 2 Years Still Comfortable ..A Great Product !!!
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly durable and comfortable. Retired firefighter traveling the south and have slept on this every night for two months. I luv it !!! A quality product..industructible !!! After 2 years I still love this cot.. Having broken both my back and neck this is the only comfortable bed that I've found. The mattress did start to slide a bit so I taped it in place with gorilla tape. Sign me..a comfortable retired firefighter...(still traveling).
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great cot, easy to store.
customer_reviews.text: Was exactly what we needed. The pad is thin so we added the mattress off our old broken cot to this one. We used for my son after surgery when he couldn't get up the stairs, set him up with this in the living room. Worked great, he slept on it for about 2 weeks. Over all I do not think it would be good for long term sleeping without additional padding. It folds up flat and stores great. We will be using again at Christmas for company. Overall we are happy with the item.
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: Great cots!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these after camping with an air mattress that couldn’t hold air. I set them up side by side, put an egg crate mattress topper on it and a fitted sheet to hold it all together. Two cots make a queen bed! They are comfortable enough for camping and guests alike. I’m on the upper end of the weight limit and so far no creaking or noise when I sit down, roll over, etc. I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Braaten

customer_reviews.title: My son uses this cot - springs wear out
customer_reviews.text: The drawback with these cots is the springs - although I guess they provide for a comfortable cot, they wear out - either the spring bends or the metal rod in the cot sleeping surface they hook on to bends - then the springs start to fall out and get lost and the bed starts to sag. My son who is 6'5" and weights over 200lbs usually wears one of these out in about 6 months of nightly use. Yes, he sleeps on the cot outdoors every night (it's a long story) rain or shine - indoors if the temp is too cold. But at least they are not uber-expensive.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTOPHER H LYNT

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for those with back/leg issues!!!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I used to use foam pads or air mattresses when camping until she was diagnosed with RA. That was a game changer but so are these cots. We bought two and tested the other night. Both of us had a great night sleep. We bought the smaller cots due to our tent footprint. I am 6' and 215 pounds. Cot is very sturdy for my weight. My feet hang off the end but I knew that when we bought it. Friends have these too and pointed us in this direction and we are very glad they did.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen L.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and the box makes for handy storage underneath
customer_reviews.text: Buddy and I each purchased one of these cots for a camping trip to southern Wyoming. The ground is uneven, rock/gravel, and not comfortable with a pad alone. These cots were very comfortable. I'm 5'-10" and under 200 lbs so I'm not putting much stress on the cot, but my back and shoulders felt great every morning. While large and bulky, the cot and box fit nicely on top of a truck bed load to make securing the load much easier (we had a tarp covering everything as well). The box top and bottom fit neatly under the cot to allow for storage inside the tent that you can easily access by sliding the box, an unexpected bonus!
customer_reviews.author: read more often

customer_reviews.title: Great sleepover/camping cot
customer_reviews.text: This is a great sleep over/guest type cot. It folds easily for storage and is very comfortable. I purchased numerous air mattresses and got tired on how little they lasted. I would recommend purchasing a 2 inch memory foam mattress topper for it, I bought a twin size and cut it to fit the cot which is smaller than a standard twin size bed. To summarize this cot is comfortable, folds in half for easy storage and for putting it in the trunk of your car for camping or a sleepover somewhere. We have 2 cots that we use for guests and also when we sleep at my mother in law's house.
customer_reviews.author: scruddie

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for unexpected nights of short turnarounds at work, and was pleasantly surprised! I didn’t expect much comfort being that this is just a cot, but for a handful of nights I’ve been so glad that I’ve invested in this one! The padding is thick enough to sleep well for a quick night away from my bed at home. I’m about 5’5, about 125lbs, and the size of this cot fit me perfectly. My only CONs would be that I wish the frame wasn’t so heavy and it folded up smaller. Otherwise, I’m a happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: Sha

customer_reviews.title: Does what you'd want it to do
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cot as I needed to avoid stairs for a week. I'm 6'2" 250. The mattress is thin, but as described. The spring-loaded support helps with comfort. No middle beams to worry about (if you ever slept on an old sleeper-sofa, you know what I mean). I'm a side-sleeper and this worked out just fine. I'll keep it around for any guests who might sleep over.
customer_reviews.author: whatever

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous about switching to a cot from an air mattress, but I wanted to be up off the floor a little higher for ease of getting up and down. This cot is very comfortable. I slept three nights camping on it, and my body felt better than it did when I used an air mattress. The cot is easy to unfold for set up, and also very easy to pack away. It was also very sturdy feeling. It's pretty large even when folded, so that's something to consider, but I have the space so it worked. All in all, it's definitely worth it since it's so comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Dervetski

customer_reviews.title: I'm tired
customer_reviews.text: In a minute or two I have a "bed". Very comfortable! The spring design is the same as the bed I used the first 16 years of my life except there are a whole lot more springs. I actually use this once in a while in my living room because it's so comfortable. Travels easy, fits almost anywhere, a little short for my 5' 9" frame but it says 5' 7" max. My feet hang off the end but I sleep great. Only thing better is a real bed.
customer_reviews.author: Seth.H

customer_reviews.title: Great cot, but could have been designed better.
customer_reviews.text: Great cot, but the Velcro strap intended to keep it closed is difficult to KEEP closed. They should have added a 2nd strap spaced evenly apart. Buy a small bungee cord to keep it secured. In my opinion, one major thing this lacks is a storage bag like most camping gear has. A well designed bag would have made it possible to carry this hands free too. Expect one extra trip each way just for this. Comfort- wise this cot is 5 stars. Good height off the ground allows for gear stored underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Twin Papa

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this cot. So much better than sleeping on the ground. I'm a 230 pound man and was worried I would break it by just sitting on it. So far it's been a couple of months and it's holding up. It is not small when you fold it up as it only folds in half but it is quite simple and light. The size is just right as I'm 6 foot tall. I would totally recommend it. As far as how it could be better. I would wish they redesign it so that at least one or both sides could incline at least a little to facilitate reading or using a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Telting

customer_reviews.title: I love this cot!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cot!! It is well padded and very comfortable to sleep on (which is saying a lot for me. My family members have likened me to "The Princess and the Pea". I'm very particular about what I sleep on). The frame is very strong and durable. The sleeping surface is made of thick canvas-like material and attached to the frame with strong springs. It comes with a 1 1/2 inch pad (approximately) that is covered with material that looks waterproof. The cot is easy to setup and fold, plus it has a Velcro strap to keep the cot folded.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up for camping
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for camping so I don't have to blow up my air mattress every time. Although the cot is heavier and takes up more storage space, I really do like it! It's very easy to set up and comfortable. I do wish it were just a little wider (I move around and turn over a lot throughout the night) but overall I'm very satisfied. I still prefer my air mattress as far as comfort goes, but I have a small tent and my mattress literally went wall to wall and halfway up the side of my tent, so this allows me to save space since and it's way easier to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Great Cot, but kind of Large
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cot, I got it for a camping trip and loved it. Also, After having our first child my wife wasn't sleeping great, and she would use this in the basement to take naps, and it was very helpful. I am bigger guy and roll around a bit, and this is a bit wider then I would normally think a cot would be which was nice. Two biggest cons I have with this is that while it easy to fold up, the Velcro that holds it together doesn't seem to hold it when used. Also for traveling this is very large, and can be kind of cumbersome compared to an air mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, sturdy and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This cot is great! It is way more comfortable than other cots hands down, no comparison. It folds out very easily and is very sturdy. I am 6'1 280 lbs and love this thing. The only downside is that it doesn't fold nearly as small as other folding cots. That is the trade off. If you need a cot and have the room to store this it is definitely your best bet. I feel the price is also good for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: DTMFM

customer_reviews.title: Not great!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this cot now off and on for 6 weeks. It doesn't set up right. One end is always off the ground and there is no way to lock it into place. My son is 5'5 and weighs 102 and the side where the springs connect are already sagging. It does fold up nicely with the matress inside, but it isn't sturdy and doesn't seem like it will last a summer. I'm very disappointed because Coleman is a brand I've grown up with. I will be returning this cot as soon as I can find a box big enough..
customer_reviews.author: CedarWho7

customer_reviews.title: Finally comfortable camping!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a Coleman cot for each member of the family this year! I now sleep almost better camping than I do in my bed at home! My family has camped extra this year! Plus, so much time saved on pumping or blowing up air mattresses. So worth the $!! This particular disease was best for my tall husband.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seriously, Had To Clean This Cot, smh
customer_reviews.text: It seems well made and it is sturdy. The cushion on it could be better but for what it is and the cost, good to go. A more dense foam could have been used. I took the cot out of the sealed bag and noticed the frame was dusty dirty. What's up with that? The mattress wasn't as dirty and cleaned up nice. Also, that was a white clean wash cloth I used, smh NASTY!! Only 3 stars for the nasty. Luckily it didn't come broke because I had to wait 3 extra days for delivery. I should take off another star. I'm a Prime Member, 2 day delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Durable and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this camp cot for over 100 nights and I’m 270# it’s held up quite well and is very comfortable. A great purchase, and I’m a side sleeper. I only wish it was about 4 inches wider.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen K

customer_reviews.title: Never sleep on the ground again.
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer I love Coleman products. Sturdy steel frame. Furniture grade springs with a back you could sleep on. The mattress is a better quality of a lesser Coleman cot. I slept 8 hrs the first night. A bed for kids, night in the dog house or camping.
customer_reviews.author: Black Hat

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This cot has come in handy. It makes a reasonably comfortable bed for short-term stays. A tall or very large person would probably have difficulty with it. I am average size, 5 foot 4 in and am able to sleep very comfortably on this bed. The product arrived with a small tear along the seam of the mattress however this did not impact it's usability. The cot folds flat and slides easily under a bed for storage. I recommend this product and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Twila R.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For A Temporary Bed
customer_reviews.text: I tried using an ultra-light packable camping cot and had a miserable experience. This cot? You won't be lugging it up a mountain, but it is absolutely perfect for camping out of your vehicle or just staying over a friend's house. It is long, wide, and comfortable. I did not feel the springs whatsoever thanks to the mattress pad that is included. Although it is quite large, it at least folds in half nicely and fits in the back seat of my truck. I don't think there is going to be a comfier cot choice for this size of bed.
customer_reviews.author: Corky

customer_reviews.title: Great Cot, comfortable, durable. Long lasting!
customer_reviews.text: Very good bed. I brought it to use as my bed while my pregnant daughter took my room for a while. It lasted 6 months, no problems whatsoever. Never tipped over, never flattened or ripped open. I would just pull it out at night and set up in my living room and it worked wonders. Comfortable and durable. A great buy. And now it's tucked away safe in the closet, waiting for it's next use for guests or holidays. I'm about 156 lbs in case someone needs a weight reference, but it says it can hold up to 300 lbs. I believe it!
customer_reviews.author: Ponytail

customer_reviews.title: Great old man camping bed solution.
customer_reviews.text: We have progressed from mats, to airbed to these cots. Getting old, we are. They sleep very well. It is harder to get off with your legs hanging over the edge than I expected. It is very tight to get 2 of these in a 4-man tent, but we normally use a huge family tent. They fit nicely in a 6 man tent, probably room for a kid if you need and don't want to be too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Migliore

customer_reviews.title: Great cot
customer_reviews.text: Camped with this for the first time last weekend and put a 4” memory foam mattress on it which made the mattress MUCH more comfortable than if it were just on the ground. Didn’t even use the mat that comes with it. The price on here was much better than in stores. The only bad thing is that it only folds to half of its size, so it’s still pretty large for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Should have been camping with this years ago!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Tent camping is so much nicer with these cots! They are a good deal price-wise too as they include a sleeping pad. They are a little large as they fold up like a chaise lounge chair, but that's a small price to pay for the comfort they bring. This also gives us more room in our tent as we can stash items underneath them.
customer_reviews.author: leisureholic

customer_reviews.title: good but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I like this for tent camping. The reason for four stars is that I think it is overpriced for sure. Also, there is no case to carry it. I created something so it doesn't collect dust or get scuffed up during transport. For the price (or even for a quality standpoint) a little slip bag would be have been nice.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Totally satisfied
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 for tent camping. Very sturdy and light weight. I like the smooth leg design that won't puncture the tent floor. We are able stor store thing under them and save room. The spring suspension is comfortable and no uncomfortable cross supports . Grand daughters like them for sleep overs better than a bed .
customer_reviews.author: Stemwind

customer_reviews.title: Comfy cot. Strong.
customer_reviews.text: A large and comfortable cot. Unfolds easily and quickly. The only downside is that it takes up a lot of room when folded up since it only folds in half. But if you have the space, get this one. Very comfy and sturdy. The included pad is a nice touch. I’m a bigger guy, 6’ 235 lbs and I feel safe sleeping on this.
customer_reviews.author: lefthandedrighty

customer_reviews.title: There when you need it , lots of support.
customer_reviews.text: Here is what I like about the ComfortSmart Cot... it is big enough for a 6' guy with a little bit of room to spare. I have three other Coleman cots similar to this in various sizes. through the years, they have been there when I needed them. Sleepover for 4 girls? check. Fit 4 in our tent? check. Probably the biggest con is that they are bulky. No question that a cot is bulkier than an air mattress. But it lasts longer (dont have to worry if it is going to inflate!) and gets you off the ground in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hood

customer_reviews.title: Great guest bed alternative
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a temporary bed setup at the in-laws. So far it's doing great! I did however opt to get a 3 inch mattress topper and additional cushion (I needed the extra softness for a more relaxed sleep). Overall though, I'm very satisfied with the quality and build quality of the frame itself. It folds up very nicely and I haven't had any issues of the bed shifting while sleeping on it or the springs making any additional noises when I move around on the cot. Highly recommend this cot - can't wait to use it on my next camping trip too!
customer_reviews.author: Aloha NinjaTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Comfort, ease and value
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for when my teenage nieces and nephews come to visit. I wish I would have found them years ago, I’ve gone through countless air mattresses! Easy to open and set up, and actually not uncomfortable (I’m 5’8”, 190 lbs). Definitely would get a couple more if I had room to store them. Couldn’t ask for a better product!
customer_reviews.author: Annie C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the unexpected overnighter.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband who often has to work crazy hours at a hospital. When he has unexpected mechanical failures at work or has to stay overnight due to bad weather this allows him to get a couple hours in the comfort of his office. Folds up and doesnt take a lot of space when not in use. He has had to use it a few times and being 6"3 he said it was comfortable enough. It is a cot after all, but definitely better then most.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Mathias

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Will easily move if you're getting up or rolling over quickly with it placed on a hard surface bc it's light weight. Middle support sits to one side or another sort of unevenly. This doesnt effect comfortability but slightly, I just wish they had made it sit flush. Works great for what I need it for, and hasn't broken yet in any way like another one as ertized on Amazon that broke the 2nd time I used it. This one packs and unpa ks pretty quick. included pad is a bit noisy when you're adjusting your posture
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Curd

customer_reviews.title: A very comfortable cot at a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I love this cot. A good friend,who travelled with my wife and I on a 5 week camping trip through Alaska and the Yukon two yea s ago,used this cot. I finally decided on most recent Death Valley trip to abandon sleeping on the floor of our backpacking tent with air mattresses and get this cot. Great, lots of room, wide enough and much more comfortable than any other air mattres/ foam pad I’ve used in 40 years of camping (of course I’ll have to get a bigger tent to fit two of these.) And at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: F. Norman

customer_reviews.title: Quality and comfortable Coleman cot
customer_reviews.text: Love my new Coleman cot! Once or twice a week I stay with a developmentally disabled client at an Activity Center so her family can have respite. Last night I slept on the cot for the first time. I have back and neck issues and have a lot of trouble sleeping due to these issues, so I was concerned that this was not going to work out. However, the cot was really comfortable and I actually slept well. It is pleasantly wider and longer than I expected. It has a comfortable mattress that came with it and it is easy to set up and fold away for storage. Definitely happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: S. Bettis

customer_reviews.title: Center support needs work.
customer_reviews.text: This is a.ln ok cot but has a few flaws. Biggest flaw was what you see in the picture. It feels like the center support should lock in. So what ends up happening is that when you move it rocks back and forth. When you sit on it that will poke you under your knee. If you are a side sleeper and pull your leg(s) up you will inevitably hit it with your knee and definitely wake up. Everything else about it is workable. It beats sleeping on an lumpy forest floor.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene P

customer_reviews.title: Very good cot, even better when we added another padding.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have been tenting camping for years. Now that we are getting up there in years, we wanted something a bit more comfortable compared to sleeping on the ground in our tent. The cots are fairly comfortable with the padding, but when we added the padding that we normally used when we slept on the ground to the top of the cot padding, it was great. Now we can put supplies and other things under our cots and keep our tent a bit more organized. These cots are large and only fold up in half, so storing them can be a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cot for the price. Its got a solid frame, spring platform and sleeping pad. It's a little heavy and bulky when folded but this seems a small price to pay for something I know will not collapse. I am 5' 11'' and hang off the ends a little when stretched out lengthwise, however the cot is wide enough to bend my knees slightly an sleep comfortably on my side. Its shorter length allows me to set it up in my Wrangler Unlimited (with one of the back seats removed) giving me the ability to get a great nights sleep in the jeep and additional storage space under the cot.
customer_reviews.author: Scottsville Stu

customer_reviews.title: Beats sleeping bag or air mattress
customer_reviews.text: While this takes up more room than a sleeping bag or air mattress, it's worlds better. For fall and winter camping, this is a must. Keeping you off the ground so you stay warmer. While you can add a sleeping pad for the sleeping bag, uneven ground still makes for a hard night. Overall, it's easy to setup, take down. Just be aware, there is a top and a bottom side. Sleeping at what should be the foot of the bed, will be uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: ally

customer_reviews.title: middle part bends after a while
customer_reviews.text: i know it's not supposed to be an actual bed, but honestly, it started bending where the hips are after couple of nights i expected the metal holds to last longer but again, its not meant to be an actual bed. i use it for my college dorm. it gets the job done and the mattress that comes with definitely helps. but again, little bit disappointing that it bent so early
customer_reviews.author: Young A. Song

customer_reviews.title: The reviews are correct
customer_reviews.text: SO glad that we bought these cot. Originally got it because of a house move and needing beds to be packed. I slept on it fine, my husband was fine on another night (he's over 200 lb and over 6' tall for review reference). And our daughter is also comfy on it. It's so light and east to pack up or set up that we plan on using it for family visits, sleepovers, etc. I wouldn't take it camping just because it's pretty big even when folded and we tent-camp.
customer_reviews.author: bbmac

customer_reviews.title: Coleman ComfortSmart Cot is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: This cot is surprising comfortable. I'm not a fan of camping, but was talked into a weekend in a tent. I knew I'd have to have something off the ground. This cot was sturdy, easy to fold and I actually slept well. Now it could be easier to carry, but then I'm only 5' tall, so for a taller person, it would be easier to carry. But not too far, it is a little heavy and bulky. You wouldn't want to carry it on a wilderness trail. It's great in a campground. The mattress will slide on the cot, but I put a sheet between it and the cot and then it didn't slide. I recommend this cot highly..
customer_reviews.author: Arione

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have as extra bed at home and great bed for camping!
customer_reviews.text: We love camping and sleeping is a big problem for us because I have a back pain. Air mattress didn't work for us but this cot did! We bought 2 of these since we have 2 small dogs. It's very comfortable to sleep with and light to carry but the down side is it's too big. Too big to transport and too big for the tent. We have Gazelle T4 plus and our tent is good for 8 people and has 2 rooms. As you can see in the picture the cot is occupying the space.
customer_reviews.author: Mharje

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but the ever shifting mattress pad is frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable but the ever shifting mattress pad is frustrating. They should have built-in some simple velcro straps to let you lash the mattress down to the frame. As it is, the mattress slides on the cot surface very easily even with an adult weight upon it. Otherwise it is a fairly comfortable cot and mattress pad as far as such things go. Definitely less frustrating and more comfortable than pretty much every air mattress I've every used. Most adults would probably want to get the slightly larger version of this one which adds to the length.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip U.

customer_reviews.title: bought 2nd hand and still in great condition. I'm excited to have the new cots ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased my own after borrowing my friend's Coleman cots for years. Theirs is considerably older, with a cloth covered cushion; bought 2nd hand and still in great condition. I'm excited to have the new cots of my own. They are very comfortable, compact and convenient. Not too heavy to throw into the pickup. So far superior to ground sleeping, even with an air mattress. The best part is once the cot is set up in your tent, your gear can be stowed underneath, making a huge difference in space conservation.
customer_reviews.author: immowsi

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad At All
customer_reviews.text: We originally bought this for my daughter to entice her to camp with us more frequently. Long story short, my husband slept on the cot for its maiden voyage tent trip at Morro Bay. He thought it was just fine. I laid on it and sure enough, it was quite comfortable and the "mattress" was pretty thick. If it were me and this were my main mode of tent sleeping, I'd order an extra 3" or 4" foam mattress to put on top because why not?
customer_reviews.author: A. Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Soft and Reliably Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I've watched YouTube reviews on this cot, and am happy to have one of my own. I can relax when I have guests knowing I'll be comfortable and no longer laying on the floor on a yoga mat! I am chubby, but this cot is sturdy, soft, and light weight enough that it is easy to set up in a hurry. Worth every cent. Next time I'll order the Deluxe version in case I have tall visitors so their legs and feet won't dangle over the edge. I am five feet two inches, and this cot has more than enough room and length for me.
customer_reviews.author: CCrystals121Top Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Best camping option
customer_reviews.text: It really is night and day difference compared to a thermarest or similar air mattress when camping. Totally feels like a bed. So much better than any other option while camping. We use an aero bed as well. Added bonus: you gain extra storage space underneath that you didn't have before.
customer_reviews.author: Allison C

customer_reviews.title: This thing is very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up for tent camping in place of an army cot. The army cot was more narrow and the aluminum frame is on edge making your arm fall asleep if it lays over the edge. This cot is wider and the mattress combined with springs makes it 100% more comfortable. You can actually get a good night's sleep on this thing. Pros: 1) More comfortable 2) Wider 3) Longer 4) The mattress adds insulation for cold winter or mountain nights Cons: 1) It only folds in half, so it take more storage room 2) The legs can fold up if you aren't careful about ensuring they are fully opened when setting it up.
customer_reviews.author: PapaSierra

customer_reviews.title: Just try it for your self
customer_reviews.text: Well first it took to long to get. When I'm a prime member... Then I get it and unboxed it and it was weird the middle wasn't stay open so one side flops down and the I pull the leg out and the the other side flops down... The mattress that came with it slides and a bit to small so I pinched my thighs on the damn springs... I want to return it haven't yet used it but need a new damn box the box that came was already jacked up sooo what do what to do...
customer_reviews.author: Ruby James

customer_reviews.title: Better than I could have imagined.
customer_reviews.text: I've been a soldier for a long time and have spent the last year on a stateside "deployment". Having to sleep at an armory, I have never liked our issued cots, so I took a chance on buying this one and do not regret it. Easy to fold and set up, and the mattress is actually impressive when used with the cot. I even tried to add a memory foam mat over top on the first night and realized that it was fine on its own. Highly recommend. Honestly, I was willing to spend two or three times more when I started looking. This was a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: KfromWV

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: This is really sturdy!! I bought the deluxe size. Huge! Yes the mattress is not thick, but no slats under it to feel through the mattress. The bed part is almost like a sling held by springs all around which makes the cot comfy for a cot! Very pleased for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice, huge, cot
customer_reviews.text: These cots are huge. They are not made for tight spaces or fits. I have one of those big 10x12 cabin tents and can fit about 4 of these in there tightly. However, if you have the room to set them up, they are glorious to sleep on. Might as well be at home sleeping in bed. Will never car camp on a air matress again. EVER! Warning these things will spoil you, your whole trip will be planned around making sure these cots can be used to sleep on!
customer_reviews.author: B. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Oustanding for small people
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of them for a 14 day camp trip in the winter time. They are up off the ground and the padding is intself insualtion so they were warm. Two teenagers using them reports they are way more confortable than the standard camp cot that has no mat. They lasted all 14 days and never broke or collapsed but then again it was only teenagers weighing under 150 pounds on them. I can tell you that if my 280 pound butt sat on one it would not hold me and it would be the end of the cots life. Works great for the teenies but im sticking with my Kamp-Rite Oversize Kwik Cot and a 6inch foam pad.
customer_reviews.author: Okie76

customer_reviews.title: Decent so far
customer_reviews.text: I havent slept on it yet. It seems sturdy for me, but im 5'2" 180.....my son has one so we'll review that later. It was nice it came together already in the box. It folds different. When you unfold it you have to flip it over. So storing it youll have to flip it first. Not too bad. Mine didnt sit upright alone but its narrow for easy storage. The frame on my son's cot was bent. So the middle doesnt fold like its supposed to
customer_reviews.author: Tamla

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy, good for side sleeping
customer_reviews.text: I liked sleeping on this cot so much I upgraded my 2 man tent to a 4 man just so that the cot would fit while camping. I am a side sleeper and 2 inch air mattresses don't cut it while camping. It is pretty big though for storage, it folds in half so you're looking at at least 40 inches when backing this in a car, does however fit in my Corolla fine. I read some reviews that said this was noisy, I don't think it is at all even with springs. I would recommend also buying a sheet to go over the mattress to keep it more clean.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Luxurious comfort! Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My son slept on this cot when visiting my sister. He said it was more comfortable than his very nice queen mattress at home, so I bought one to replace the always deflating air mattresses for guests. Everyone has loved it! We also take it with us to hotels because my kids hate sharing a bed. I purchased the Pinzon Hypoallergenic Overfilled Microplush Mattress Topper - Twin extra long( same as my sister) and it really makes it luxurious, and it will never deflate! I am going to buy another one for guests. We also camp, but not car camping. I think it would be great for car camping.
customer_reviews.author: KnitGirl45

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, plenty of surface area.
customer_reviews.text: This cot is very comfortable for me at 5'-11" and 215 lbs. My son, over 6'/220 lbs. also purchased one and found it to be very comfortable as well. They are a bit bulky when folded but the comfort is worth the size. These would be a difficult fit inside a small tent with slanted walls but are a far better sleeping surface than on the ground. The only nit to pick is that the pad must be tucked through UNDER the frame when folded, a small inconvenience for the comfortable sleeping surface it provides!
customer_reviews.author: Trackster Geezer

customer_reviews.title: Used item
customer_reviews.text: I received one that looks like someone purchased it, used it, and then returned it. I don't like getting used items when I purchase new. The mattress pad looks dirty and I'm debating on whether to wash it, because it is fairly inexpensive, or return it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: We needed an option for our daughter because we use her room as a guest room & I wanted her to be comfortable too. She loves this cot! Twin size bedding is a smidge big, but that is what we used and it worked just fine. It's thin enough to store behind the door in my husband's office, so that is a win/win! Great buy & I am glad we chose this one!
customer_reviews.author: EMarie

customer_reviews.title: Portable, light weight, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It's a cot so you're not gonna be amazingly comfy but much better than a deflating air mattress or the floor and it's super lightweight and easy to fold and unfold. I suggest getting a little fitted sheet for the mattress pad it has or yours gonna get rug burn on your elbows when you turn over. Otherwise solid buy!
customer_reviews.author: Leah Borja

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Coleman Cot
customer_reviews.text: Actually purchased for people to lay out in the sun. Omg. So comfortable and maybe to nice for sunbathing. Worth the price completely.
customer_reviews.author: Terry M

customer_reviews.title: We love these cots - we used to sleep on air ...
customer_reviews.text: We love these cots - we used to sleep on air mattresses when camping, but dreaded those sleepless nights Purchased two of these, and got a great night's sleep. It's a super sturdy cot, very compact, and great to keep under a bed for kid sleepovers, etc. My parents have this cot too, and have set it up in a tight hallway for a grandchild to sleep on when they have a full house. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M.E.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable cot
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for the bed of my mid sized pickup. I ordered the smaller size and found it to fit just right in the back of my 6ft bed on my truck. I’m a young man who is 5’7 and around 140lbs. For larger/taller individuals this size would not be comfortable. The springs on this make it much more comfortable than other cots I’ve tried. The pad it comes with is pretty comfortable but I put my own 5in memory foam topper on it and cut it to size.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It's much more comfortable than I was expecting. There are no hard bars across your back or springs jabbing at you. I'm 5'9 and wasn't bothered by my feet hanging off the end. Side sleeping is rough because my knees did hit the side bars, but maybe that's just me. It would be great for camping, kids, or for an emergency. Not sure I'd have company sleep on it unless they were a little shorter. Will I throw away my regular mattress and just use this? No, but I wasn't expecting to.
customer_reviews.author: A. L. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: A good night's sleep wherever you are!
customer_reviews.text: These cots are amazing! More comfortable than my bed at home. The cots keep you elevated off the ground for a warmer and obviously less bumpy camping sleep experience. One of the reasons we picked these was the leg configuration. The way the legs on these fold there are no balance issues (sideways collapsing cots) when sitting on the side of the cot. The legs and frame are sturdy enough for heavier individuals. A little more expensive than others, but so worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Cyprus

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Cot
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice cot for the price. It was used for an extra bed for my grandchildren and it worked just great. The one and only thing that I didn't like was that when I went to fold it up to put it away I couldn't get the mattress squeezed back between the frame like it had been so that the velcro strap would hold it closed. Other than that it is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: foxylady

product_meta.title: Coleman ComfortSmart Cot
feature_bullets: Folding camping cot offers bed-like comfort for a restful night's sleep
Provides superior support with coil suspension system and thick foam mattress
Durable steel frame can support up to 275 pounds and accommodate most people up to 5 feet 7 inches tall
Portable design fits into most car trunks when folded; Comfortable covered foam mattress pad
Measures 69 x 25 x 15 inches when unfolded
